intro: Godetia viminea var. incerta, commonly known as the softstemmed godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
